abstractText: The white-tailed deer cover pole was developed to estimate screening/hiding cover (in a white-tailed deer HEP model (Ashley et.al.1998) habitat variable). The pole measures one inch (2.54 cm) in diameter, is  50 inches (1.5 m) in height, and is divided into three sections each measuring 16.66 inches (0.5 m). Sections are alternately colored red and white as illustrated in Figure 26.
title: Estimate screening/hiding cover v1.0
